channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Path is being dug up to create big dips and mounds, 14th January
item.description:
This started before Christmas and is getting worse. One mound is about 2ft high and second one has now appeared. Area is littered with planks on the path, a trolley and various items to the side including a dustbin and digging equipment

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ramp/cover plate used for covering footpath excavation has been abandoned on pavement., 14th January
item.description:
It has been laying on the pavement for a number of weeks. It could be a trip hazard. It needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Tottenham Lane, Hornsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 14th January
item.description:
Southwood rd had a walk down towards the park entrance and more bags of clothes that nobody wanted from the boot fair , something needs to be done or STOP having boot fairs because this sits on the streets for weeks and I have to look at this mess and it’s embarrassing when I have friends around to my house

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolf Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of rubbish accumulating outside the garages at 1a Granville road N12 0JG, 14th January
item.description:

item.title: Car parked on pavement, 14th January
item.description:
Car drives up and parks on pavement on a daily basis, causing a danger to pedestrians.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brownswood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive littering, 14th January
item.description:
We live on Woodrow in SE London. Excessive littering and dog fouling is always present in this and surrounding streets. We had to lock up our bins as people use it for dog poo (untied bags!). Public bins and those for dog poo need to be installed in the area, along with signs that warn of fines. Regular fly tipping is always present in the area, too. This issue has been constant for the two years we have lived here. We will move away as soon as possible, as it’s very depressing to live in such a dump, something we sadly didn’t realise when we moved here.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodrow, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road signage., 14th January
item.description:
Large pothole outside no74 The Drive has been repaired but it had the SLOW sign across it. The SLOW has been half repainted today and now displays OW as you drive down the road. Surely the SL should have been repainted at the some time as it is almost worn out.. How ridiculous this looks for Bromley Council OW in the road !!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pothole at the corner turning on Annandale Road, 14th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Annandale Road, Greenwich
